variants.Description in input context: This variant was found in the TP53 gene, and it causes a change from glutamic acid (Glu) to arginine (Arg) at position 277 in the protein.

Readout description.Result Description Sequencing: The Sanger sequencing confirmed the presence of the c.812A>G variant in the TP53 gene.
Readout description.Result Description Western Blot: Western blot analysis showed no detectable levels of p53 protein in the cells expressing the mutant version.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent biological replicates were performed for each experiment.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate for both Sanger sequencing and Western blot analysis.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type cDNA and protein were used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t-test for Western blot analysis.

Threshold for normal readout Sequencing.Threshold for normal readout: The TP53 gene should have no sequence changes or variants of unknown significance.

Threshold for abnormal readout Sequencin.Threshold for abnormal readout: Presence of a pathogenic variant in the TP53 gene.

Threshold for normal readout Western Blo.Threshold for normal readout: p53 protein should be detectable at expected levels.

Threshold for abnormal readout Western B.Threshold for abnormal readout: Absence or reduced levels of p53 protein.
